complaint_summary: The petitioner claimed he was allotted inferior land and not given his full entitlement. He opposed the separation of his co-sharer Khia's share in Scheme No. 474.
investigation_summary: The record showed that the petitioner and his co-sharer Khia received 5 kanals-17 marlas less land (in terms of Class I) than their entitlement after consolidation.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the revision petition but directed the Collector (Cons.) to make good the shortage of 3 kanals-17 marlas (in terms of Class I) from respondents who received excess land. The request to keep Khia's share joint was rejected to avoid friction and litigation.
Decision_or_verdict: Revision dismissed with modification to address land shortage.
legal_arguments: Petitioner argued he was allotted inferior land and requested Khia's share not be separated.
Court found petitioner and Khia received less land than entitled and directed correction.

key_points.grievance: Petitioner claims inferior land allocation and incomplete entitlement.
key_points.shortage: 5 kanals-17 marlas (in terms of Class I)
key_points.remand_order: Case remanded to A.C.O. for separation of Khia's share and adjustment of shortage.
key_points.request_rejected: Petitioner's request to not separate Khia's share was rejected.

modification: Shortage of 3 kanals-17 marlas in Scheme No. 474 to be adjusted from respondents with excess Class I land.
remarks: Keeping joint khata may lead to friction and litigation between co-sharers.

legal_terms.Khata: A record of land ownership and division among co-sharers.

words_and_phrases.Consolidation: The process of reorganizing land holdings to improve efficiency and equity.
words_and_phrases.Co-sharer: A person who jointly owns a property with others.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a revision petition under Section 13 of the Consolidation of Holdings Ordinance, 1960. The petitioner claimed inferior land allocation and opposed separation of co-sharer's share. The court dismissed the petition but directed correction of land shortage from respondents who received excess land.
